website_summaries.verdict: Good set of features in a brad nailer. Can adjust nail depth to handle many types of jobs.
pros: Works with 18 gauge brad nails ranging in size from 0.625 to 2 inches
Well-designed brad nailer that includes comfortable hand grip and lightweight body
Can clear jams easily without the need for tools
Allows for use of brad nails with varying head sizes
Exhaust vent can be rotated 360 degrees
cons: May experience misfires more often than with some other models

customer_reviews.title: Declining quality. Moving on.
customer_reviews.text: I use these nailers in a professional shop environment and for installation work on-site. This model was at one time a rock solid tool. The last two I’ve purchased have had the same, fatal flaw: the spring-loaded mechanism inside the magazine that is supposed to hold the nails and push them towards the front does not stay tight against the wall of the chamber. This causes it to slip and bypass the nails, both jamming them inside the magazine, and jamming the magazine slide cover so tight that it is difficult to remove and clear. This gun might be fine for the DIY, but for someone who might be firing several hundred nails at a time, it just doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry S. Hale

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and powerful nailer
customer_reviews.text: I use this to install interior trim work. One of the hardest things to find when it comes to finish nailers is a truly "non marring" safety plunger. This one is as close as I've ever used (25 plus years as a Carpenter). It has plenty of power to drive brads through the harder woods like oak and maple. It has great balance and trigger control. It's not overly bulky and is able to fit into awkward places. Came with a nice durable case, safety glasses, 2 non-marring nose pads and pre-installed quick connect (universal) and adjustable exhaust port (on tool).
customer_reviews.author: OlyNomad

customer_reviews.title: Consistent depth, no jamming, but leaves a mark larger than the trim nail
customer_reviews.text: Bought to hang trim (baseboard and crown moulding) in a basement finish and after refinishing hardwood floor (removing the existing baseboard and re-installing). Used with 2" DeWalt brand 18 gauge nails. Had only one jam, fired about 800 nails in total. Pretty consistent in depth, with maybe 10 nails left a little proud, most of them when nailing crown moulding into 50 year old joists in the basement. The main nit-pick is that the hole is often bigger than the nail. Sometimes it's just the nail's size, but more often it's an elongated depression. It's still pretty small, and I was painting the trim anyway, but for stain grade trim I would find it unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Recommend for the Money!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product based on price more than anything. I placed shoe mold thorough out my 1700 sq ft house. I was nervous based on some of the reviews but this product did exactly as it was suppose too. I can't put it down. I have completed multiple jobs (household chores, arts and crafts, etc) and am completely satisfied. No issues with angles or anything. With the right settings, it counter sinks perfectly. The ability to use different nail/brad sizes is also a huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Hancock

customer_reviews.title: You can’t go wrong with HITACHI- METABO...well yes, you can go wrong with this nailer
customer_reviews.text: Great nailer. Top of the line tools UPDATE: Initially I rated this Brad nailer 5 stars. However after 3 months of very light use it broke and came apart while I was nailing a vinyl brick molding. In the past I’ve had great experience with the Hitachi tools but this Metabo is a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: V. Hazera

customer_reviews.title: What happen to Hitachi???
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these guns to replace my old worn out Hitachi brad nailers and going to just give up on them. They constantly jam the nails up in the magazine, seems to have way too much slop. Use nothing but Hitachi brand nails. Should of kept the old guns and just rebuilt them. These are very poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Tetlow

customer_reviews.title: It's good, but not amazing
customer_reviews.text: The nailer works very well. The nail slot/cartridge it's a little bit fussy sometimes. It has plastic and metal parts and seems to only like high quality/More expensive nails - The less expensive nails from harbor freight or other discount retailers frequently gets stuck in the gun. It's very loud for such a small nailer and the plastic dress/trim fell off the front on my second day of use. I think there is a another unit that has a higher quality nail cartridge made of aluminum. I'm not really disappointed in the performance in the unit, I just wish the nail cartridge didn't get bunked up so often and then it wasn't so dang loud
customer_reviews.author: AmznAtomic724

customer_reviews.title: flimsy & some features stopped working i
customer_reviews.text: a plastic decorative piece came off upon arrival; started to jam after 200-300 shots; continued firing mode stopped working
customer_reviews.author: P. Hu

customer_reviews.title: Jams Regularly
customer_reviews.text: This is the classic you get what you paid for. This thing jams frequently and will frustrate the heck out of you unjamming it.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Hitachi but lower quality?
customer_reviews.text: I have a few hitachi nailers. No problems. First brad out of this metabo beauty and a big black chunk of decorative black plastic on the nailer flew off. First, it was a useless piece of decoration, serving no purpose. Second, it wa s held on inadequately by a splotch of blue. I’m hoping the rest of the nailer is not substandard. Did hitachi go cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Brad nailer for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Very very impressed. I don't seem to ever go wrong with the Hitachi brand on my tools. I have a grinder I love plus a great 12v drill set. I also love my small hitachi miter saw. This is a light yet powerful little Brad nailer that we used on our house doing the trim and baseboards with and also I've used it in my sign making business for quarter round and frames. Perfect exhaust and very lightweight. Well done hitachi and Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Neill

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Will not feed full stick of brads. It jams & doesn’t shoot any nails. This is very aggravating when you’re working along & realize it hasn’t been putting out nails but not sure when it stopped. Works a little better when I break the stick of nails in half. This happens with the Hatachi brand nails that I ordered specifically for this brad nailer.
customer_reviews.author: Clint O.

customer_reviews.title: Failed immediately Shot one brad all the way in and was done
customer_reviews.text: I have a brand new small campbell hausfeld air compressor that has only been used a few times before I used it to try this new Hitachi Brad nailer. The Hitachi nailer put in one nail all the way in and no more after that. My first instinct was to get a Dewalt or any other brand than a Hitachi and I should have gone with my first instinct.
customer_reviews.author: Kim E. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Comes on a nice casa and safety glasses
customer_reviews.text: Work as described only thing the rubber of the handle is ripped. Comes on a nice casa and safety glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Well......
customer_reviews.text: While I like Hitachi products, the two problems I have with this gun is that you can't really shoot from an angle. It has to be pretty much a straight shot, or it won't fire. The other problem is that you don't know when you've run out of nails. Some guns won't fire when it's empty. This will continue to fire until you finally figure out that you've been shooting blanks.
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: Proud Nails
customer_reviews.text: Would not drive a 2" brad/finish nail. Turned up air, adjusted gun, tried different material, .... nothing worked.
customer_reviews.author: CD3

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I own a bunch of cordless Hitachi tools and they have never given me any issues despite my abuse. So when I finally for fed up with my no name nailer/stapler leaving huge divots in every piece of trim and molding, I went for this nailer. This thing is great. Light, easy trigger pull, and best of all no marks except for the nail head. Would definitely recommend this, especially over a nailer/stapler combo
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a PC brad nailer that lasted about 14 years. It probably just needs a rebuild, but I'm busy and don't have time for that right now, so it will be resurrected some day. In comparison, the Hitachi is a little lighter and needs a little less pressure on the tip to fire, so it's less likely to mar the surface. It came out of the box, got a couple drops of oil and went straight to work.
customer_reviews.author: JPC

customer_reviews.title: Hitachi NT50AE2 18 ga
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my PC brad nailer. The parts to repair my PC brad nailer totaled $55.00, this Hitachi Brad nailer cost $59.00, no brainer to just go with a new gun. It works great, light and looks well built.
customer_reviews.author: 2hawk feathers

customer_reviews.title: if you guys don't fix and test your product very soon you guys go out of business
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed does not shoots 2 Inch Nails I've tried several different brands and they dont work also very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Aliks

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I bought it it has always left the nails sticking out. I always have to use a finish nail punch to make sure it goes into the trim
customer_reviews.author: Randy De La Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely disappointed by this nail gun after a few months. The part that depresses against the work piece became very loose and required tightening to TRY and fix the problem. It constantly doesn’t strike the nail properly and jams.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Brady

customer_reviews.title: I really like this nailer
customer_reviews.text: I like the angled male air connect - simple thing but glad Metabo thought of it. I've used it a week now and it has worked nearly flawlessly. Rarely jams and it's really nice to get through at least one cabinet or drawer without having to dig out a nail.
customer_reviews.author: Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and light to hold
customer_reviews.text: This Brad nailer is wonderful! I hook it up to my air compressor and it works perfectly. It is light weight and easy to hold and mail trim into place. Great purchase! Comes in it's own little case with some nice safety glasses as well!
customer_reviews.author: Dallin & Heather

customer_reviews.title: Shooting on a angle
customer_reviews.text: Hopefully someone will point out that I'm doing something wrong, however I can't shoot brads on a angle. As long as the gun is flat on the wood, either horizontally or vertically, it works fine. However trying to toenail a brad does not seem to work. I've made sure the safety is up. Secondly, after the second shot from new, the plastic piece on the side flew off. This was a easy fix with contact cement. For what I paid for it, it seems like a pretty decent gun. I use it for small woodworking projects. Thanks..
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Used a couple of times for baseboards. This replaces ...
customer_reviews.text: Used a couple of times for baseboards. This replaces an older Paslode fuel cell model. This Hitachi is soooo much more reliable and lighter than the Paslode. And, the price of this nailer is less than the unreliable Paslode batteries plus fuel cells. Quality tool that I expect to get many years of use out of
customer_reviews.author: jmac

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have never used an air nailer before, but I find myself doing quite a few diy type projects around the house so I bought this. Even though I haven’t used it a whole lot. It has saved me a ton of time with putting up baseboards and other trims around the house. Very easy to use, very lightweight, and seems really safe to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: Bought this when it was on sale. I have had multiple Hitachi branded tools and never have been disappointed. This finish nail gun being the same. Built a fireplace mantel and soon will do trim on the last part of a remodel. Tool makes finish nailing very easy to do. Lowe’s sells the nail, however unfortunately Home Depot dose not.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Very good lower cost nailer. I had been using a very cheap Campbell Hausfeld nailer, but it left pretty big indents and damage to the wood, requiring lots of putty. I purchases this Hitachi, and wow! It drives the nails in smooth and clean, leaving only the smallest hole to putty. Very nice nailer and a great tool to have.
customer_reviews.author: NicholasTop Contributor: Sunglasses

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on the strength of a review by a guy who makes his living with it. He claimed that, on the job, they treat these nail guns like dirt... dropping them, abusing them, and generally defying them to fail. He claimed that this one won't. I'll never intentionally mistreat this one, but it's good to know it will forgive me if I do. It's been a great tool for me and I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Boompa

customer_reviews.title: Works as described and is a joy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best and most economical of the small brad nailers. Local sales rep at big box store says they have far fewer of this Model returned. My use of it has been to complete tongue and groove ceiling in 400 square foot shop. Use it to make bird houses and other small projects.
customer_reviews.author: Gina E

customer_reviews.title: I am glad I made this purchase.  Better then I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Smooth operation and a perfect strike ever time. The finger dial depth setting is easy to use and consistant. Makes your work look great. The triger is perfect for index or thumb use. The size is also nice to get into smaller areas. The small bend in the air connection does help in tight places. The difference between this air tool and my electric gun is not even close. This tool blows the electric away. I did see the random spark from a strike as other have mentioned. You sould alway have your safety glasses on anyway so no big deal. Easy to load. Very light.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Detroit

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tool!
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight, but solid tool. It does what it claims, and very well. I was able to glue up and then brad nail every panel of my subwoofer box to keep it aligned as the glue dried with no trouble at all. I used 1.5" and 1" brads on my 3/4" MDF and 1/2" Baltic birch plywood with no splitting or damage. Brads punched through with no visible deflection, straight and true and nicely sunk ends. Very slick for such a low price!
customer_reviews.author: PachydermTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the gun extensively - I use it occasionally n my garage when doing wood projects (my hobby). So, as to durability, I can't comment, but as for ease of use? Absolutely tremendous. Smooth, accurate, and a pleasure to use!
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Won't Damage the Wood Surface
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool because I was doing a complete kitchen remodel and my existing nailer always leaft marks in the wood (other than the nail). I did not want my cabinet moldings to have any extra marks that would require patching. This tool worked great. I used 2", 1.5", and 1" nails. All went well.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Good gun. Have a little problem now and then with a brad missing and getting stuck inside. Also a problem with the selector switch. But have learned to use this and have used it quite a bit on kitchen remodel
customer_reviews.author: hdude

customer_reviews.title: 5 years and still running well
customer_reviews.text: I use mine quite a but as a hobbiest. But it has run several thousand nails without a problem. Just use a test piece to set the pressure on your compressor to get the depth that you want depending on length of nail and type of wood.
customer_reviews.author: WrightReviews

customer_reviews.title: Great Nailer for any DIY wood project!
customer_reviews.text: You cannot beat the price of this nailer. I've used mine for dozens of projects and it's rarely had issues. It's high quality and does exactly what I need it to do for my wood projects. Easy to maintain. My only complaint is that after a while, one of the black sides came off that was attached with some kind of glue, but doesn't affect the nailer's performance.
customer_reviews.author: Backcountry Exposure

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says on the tin. I've used it maybe ten minutes for ~100 1.25" nails total, aside form handling it to check it out initially. It's clean, well designed low/no maintenance, and let me fire about a hundred nails easily. Tighten the grip on first use if you have any leakage (any regular wrench/pliers will do), add a drop of oil for every hour or so of use (or 500-1000 nails depending on conditions). It's a bit large if you want to work in tight spaces, but a palm nailer is what you can use for that (or if you have only light duty needs use a palm instead if budget is super tight)
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Extremely Easy to Use!
customer_reviews.text: I have put a few hundred brads through this gun and it has been incredible. The depth adjustment is extremely easy. This gun is very lightweight and easy to use. A few drops of lubricating oil into the air connector, before each use, and you are good for several hundred brads. The molded carrying case and included safety glasses are also nice bonus features, considering the price of this gun.
customer_reviews.author: BigBenBravesFan

customer_reviews.title: perfect nailer
customer_reviews.text: this thing is great. it is so light and easy to use i couldn't see buying anything else. i have used it to put in about 200' of trim and has worked flawlessly so far. heck even my wife has gotten good with it. its very easy to load and check the level of nails. highly recommend this tool (and i am someone who researches the best tool so it will outlast myself and hopefully my son one day). i looked for two weeks before choosing this one taking into account cost, ease of use, number of uses, etc. i will buy another one if something ever happens to this one.
customer_reviews.author: J. C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to your tool box.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my nephew and he absolutely loved it for his home improvement business. We made sure to buy one that was compatible to his air compressor and it worked out very well.
customer_reviews.author: Wilma

customer_reviews.title: Great handling brad gun.
customer_reviews.text: Considered going with a cordless nail guns, but decided I could get more stuff with pneumatic. Replaced the fixed air chuck with a swivel, oiled and got to work fixing a trellis. Great handling, works great! Did not come with oil or any nails.
customer_reviews.author: Web Shopper

customer_reviews.title: if you want a reliable, accurate, lightweight finishing nail gun look no further this one is the one for you.
customer_reviews.text: Hitachi always makes very dependable power and pneumatic tools at a fraction of the cost. but to my experience i have used many different finishing nail guns but this one is my favorite from the tiled male connector to the grip and wheight and performance of this tool and the price well you just cant go wrong with this tool. so if you want a reliable, accurate, lightweight finishing nail gun look no further this one is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: adalberto

customer_reviews.title: Performs very well
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional woodworker by any stretch but this tool feels good, weight and balance make it comfortable for as long as I needed it to finish my project. I would recommend and buy again based upon my experience thus far.
customer_reviews.author: old school

customer_reviews.title: Very nice nailer
customer_reviews.text: One of the best nailers I have ever used hands down. Little loud but drives nails consistently every time.
customer_reviews.author: Mister D

customer_reviews.title: Good, but you can't load a full set of nails
customer_reviews.text: I like this gun, but there are two things that are a drawback. 1. Don't try to load a full amount of nails. Only load 1/2 the cartridge. The spring seems to get stuck under a lot of pressure. 2. The nib that gets pressed back when you place the gun against a piece of wood to start nailing hits the wood very hard and on any kind of softwood, it leaves a little mark under the nail hole. Just something else to apply caulking to later, if you're using this nailer on a softwood. Overall a decent product, just keep in mind the above points.
customer_reviews.author: N. Ilyin

customer_reviews.title: Solid, quality nailgun
customer_reviews.text: I have used this on and off for several months of trim installation. So far, it fires true every time whether it's a 2 or 3/4 inch nail. I like the feel, and it gets the job done. I like the multi nail firing option. Gun is very light and easy to use. I recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Spainhower

customer_reviews.title: Flawless operation with easy loading
customer_reviews.text: I've used this on several projects at home now and don't know how I did without a brad nailer this long. It takes straight nail strips and is super easy to load/unload. Nice size, good grip. A gun this size doesn't use a lot of air. I've brought my 3 gallon portable in the yard and used the gun on a couple of projects with no need to recharge the tank. Edit: I keep finding more uses for this gun and my portable compressor. I've yet to have a single misfire. I just love it. My next experiment will be a pin nailer.
customer_reviews.author: T. Beaulieu

customer_reviews.title: Awesome nailer
customer_reviews.text: This is the handiest little nailer for assembling parts quickly while glueing them together and for trimming out cabinets and doors. So far I have put about 2000 1-1/2” and 2” brads through it without a problem. Well worth the money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: MontanaOutdoorsman

customer_reviews.title: Love this nailer
customer_reviews.text: Love this nailer! Very easy to operate, runs well, built well, light weight. Accurate to, in the ways of if you set your pressure you know it will go however far down you have set it in the past. I have used it on trim, crown, quarter round, cabinets you name it. All my nailers are Hitachi. I thought they had no business making such tools, but they make awesome nailers.
customer_reviews.author: T. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Won’t feed nails
customer_reviews.text: 13 months into the 12 month warranty and the nails are not feeding. I’m a hobbyist and haven’t even had to buy more than one pack of any size of nail. Sad and disappointing. I loved it when it was new.
customer_reviews.author: Anton allen

customer_reviews.title: Overall its a good gun no issues  to talk about buy it again
customer_reviews.text: That it misfires a lot even with a full clip but also not using one before could be me to still recomend it plastic on gun fell off but glued it back on light easy to use recommend it for price got great deal on it
customer_reviews.author: robert harvey

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I was somewhat surprised at how small and light weight this thing is. It definitely does the job though. It's easy to handle and works great. I'm using 2" brads and they are going in very nicely. I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney E.

customer_reviews.title: Its great
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing its absolutely amazing, helped me build my porch swing in 1 day, very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Denis

customer_reviews.title: no good
customer_reviews.text: Its been 6 month and it jams on ever other nail , its really bad.
customer_reviews.author: zander264

customer_reviews.title: Tough, reliable gun
customer_reviews.text: Great gun. Replaces the same model that I had for 9years with no problem, until it fell. Actually $.15 cheaper than the last one.
customer_reviews.author: Terry R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Quality nailer
customer_reviews.text: So far has worked as expected. Powerful and easy to set depth.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: small and light
customer_reviews.text: Good tool and a 5 year warranty, lost mine in a move so this was a perfect replacement.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hoskinson

customer_reviews.title: Works great if you have an in-line oiler on compressor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for my Creative Zone overhaul and other projects around the house. It works as advertised, however, it does require in line oil, requiring me to make a few modifications to my pneumatic set up.
customer_reviews.author: A Malamute Mom

customer_reviews.title: This nail gun is junk. Stay away.
customer_reviews.text: This gun is junk. My advancing mechanism jams consistently now, not even a year old. Total junk.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno Design & Build

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice and really easy to use. Just hook it up and put it to work!
customer_reviews.author: 9N37

customer_reviews.title: Great unit, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Over the past couple of years had a Dewalt and a Bostich brad nailer fail me, and with the price of repairs, a new one seemed to be a better option. Bought the Hitachi for several reasons - positive reviews and price. Cannot say I'm even slightly disappointed with the purchase. Arrived within two days and so far has worked flawlessly. The unit is much lighter than the other two I had used, which is a positive when working overhead on crown, etc. The ONLY thing I wish it had was a belt hook as the Bostich did. That would make it perfect.
customer_reviews.author: jacksbd

customer_reviews.title: This nailer works great. It has easy depth adjustment
customer_reviews.text: This nailer works great. It has easy depth adjustment, rapid fire, and is fairly light and compact. Best of all, it is not expensive compared with many other brands of similar quality!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle O'Rourke

customer_reviews.title: Improved version of a good nailer.
customer_reviews.text: I never had any problems with the old version of this nailer. The main improvement to me is the no-mar tip. I almost never have a jam, and usually it is from a double shot, when it happens (or I hit another nail). Overall: Great build quality and durability Functions well with most brads Easy depth setting Easy jam clear nose Good no-mar nose Bad: Only room for one to one+half strip of brads For the price, this nailer can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: James Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! I'd buy another.
customer_reviews.text: This little baby paid for itself on the first job. I've been doing molding projects for decades but was too cheap to buy a gun because I'm more of a hobbyist and craftsman then a tradesman. I WAS WRONG! This thing saves so much time and makes my projects come out so much nicer, plus I'm able to take on many smaller and inaccessible jobs that I could never do with a hammer. It jammed on me once, but it was easy to clear.
customer_reviews.author: Educated Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Absolute junk
customer_reviews.text: Lasted about 3 years with very light usage. Now it won't fire at all. Harbor freight has a better quality Brad nailer for less than 1/2 the price.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: I had never used a nailer, but boy am I glad I bought this! It made the remodel job I did go smoothly and fast. I used mainly the 1 inch and 2 inch brads to install baseboard and moldings. I was so easy. And it attached to a craftsman compressor that I had purchased years ago to add air to my car tires. You don't really need a big compressor, just something that puts our 100 psi. I'm very happy with this nailer, I had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: grandmadeedee

customer_reviews.title: Sort of a return purchase
customer_reviews.text: I had previously bought the Hitachi 16 gauge nailer. LIked it so well that when I needed to replace my 18 gauge nailer I didn't look further than Hitachi. Just works well.
customer_reviews.author: Lutheran pastor

customer_reviews.title: no problems with this gun
customer_reviews.text: used this brad nailer for over a thousands nails sizes from 1/2 inch to 2 inch, not one jam or problems, i oil before each use, 10 drops, had it for three months, and it has worked perfectly so far, love this gun, 70 dollars is a bargain for this item, used different brad nails from lowes and home depot, including ones with a brown colored tip without a jam, don't know how easy it is to clear a jam if i get one, read the instructions and seem easy, hopefully ill never have to find out...
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey mr. video reviews

customer_reviews.title: The Hitachi is your friend
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I've had a stanley bostitch nailer for years and thought it was great. It has not been real reliable for the last couple years(needs an o-ring rebuild) Now I may have forgotten how the stanley originally operated when new, but I'm starting to doubt it. The Hitachi is an animal. I feel like I should be shouting: "Fire in the Hole" when I pull the trigger. It's really amazing, I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lincoln NE

customer_reviews.title: Been great for me
customer_reviews.text: Granted I haven't used this heavily but I have had it for almost six years and have also borrowed it out (which usually spells doom)and it continues to work perfectly. I oil it before using and use Senco brads. Currently I am driving 1 1/4" brads through 1/2 inch paneling into white oak for my grandsons toy box with absolutely no problems. Great, inexpensive tool that the wife has learned to enjoy also. Runs very well on a very small compressor.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: I have always had PorterCable nailers and this Hitachi NT50AE2 18-Gauge was better than expected. It is light weight, great features to adjust depth like my other nailers. It fits up to 2" nails which is what I needed. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Schiller

customer_reviews.title: Look before you buy or you wi have to buy twice
customer_reviews.text: This is listed as a Brad nailer but is a staple, so had to return
customer_reviews.author: Vickistratton8@gmai

customer_reviews.title: Super nice nailer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a cheap old CH nailer that came with my air compressor. This is one of the nicest finish nailers ive ever used. Easy adjustments. I will definitely buy the framing nailer in the future. For this price, you will not find a better deal.
customer_reviews.author: Josh J

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this for several door trim installations so far but I like it. It is light and easy to handle, the lack of a swiveling air fitting did not cause any problems. No jams so far, ( I was using Hitachi branded nails which may have helped, I don't know yet) but one of the reasons I chose it was the flip-open nose piece in case there ever as a jam, to make it easier to clear. I havea number of other Hitachi products, corded and cordless, and I like them all.
customer_reviews.author: akbearpaw

customer_reviews.title: Great Finish Nailer
customer_reviews.text: I borrowed one of these from a friend to do some kitchen cabinetry, and several window valences for our house. It was so handy, and made things so much easier, that I just had to have one of my own. That fact became even more evident when I learned the friend would be moving away in a few months and I wouldn't be able to borrow it again! Bummer; but I got a new tool out of it. This is a great nailer for the range of sizes it supports (3/4 up to 2 inches). Easy to use, care for; everything.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Augeri

customer_reviews.title: Best value for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Great tool! Used it quite a bit. Follow instructions for proper handling
customer_reviews.author: oran m burns

customer_reviews.title: NAIL HOLDER JAMMING
customer_reviews.text: Worked well when it was new. After about 15 uses I started to miss-fire. The cover that holds the nails in the sleeve does not have the strength to keep the spring loaded nail foward sleeve in place, and it rides on top of the nails and jams. The gun still works good, but I can only load it half way with nails.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Gallina

customer_reviews.title: Works as indicated in Product Description
customer_reviews.text: I checked out the 18 gauge nails (3/4" up to 2") and the model (NT50AE2_S_ 2" 18-Gauge Finish Nailer) drives the brad nails in nicely. It was countersinked as needed to finished the molding for painting. I have had the nailer since Christmas and used it two times. It performed better than my previously owned 18 gauge craftsman nailer. I do not know about the reliability or durability of the product since I have had it only 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Roland Davis

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer
customer_reviews.text: Before I decided to buy this brad nailer, I had borrowed one of another brand to use on a project. After my experience I decided to look into purchasing one of my own but found that it was more expensive than I expected. I began shopping for other brands and found that the Hitachi had great reviews and was well within my price range. Purchased it easily, recieved it in a timely manner, used it and became a very pleased and satisfied customer. I look forward to many more projects with it.
customer_reviews.author: B L Mc

customer_reviews.title: Don't know why I waited so long to get one
customer_reviews.text: Great little nail gun; lightweight but powerful; only negative comment is that it comes with a fixed nozzle attachment but easily replaced with a swivel version for only a few bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Robo

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: this nailer with Porter-Cable C2002-WK Oil-Free UMC Pancake Compressor 2 weeks ago and last weekend had a chance to use it for the first time. Both compressor and nailer performed well as with 5/8 inch nails as with 2 inch on the framing window and paneling project. Nailer seems to be a very good quality and performed well. I'm happy with the choice on both items. and will recommend nailer and compressor.
customer_reviews.author: vori

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: I have several pneumatic nailers and this is my favorite. Never failed me, never a nail jam. good product
customer_reviews.author: SNSKARP CAROLINA

customer_reviews.title: Been working great now for 5 years
customer_reviews.text: I do construction projects now and then, and love this nailer. I shoot the 2" nails for crown molding and casings, and shorter brads when 2" is too long. I haven't had any issues or problems with this tool in over 5 years of use. I like that it came with a case that I can store brads and a small bottle of oil. If you need a tool like this, I can recommend this one without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Hazel

customer_reviews.title: It jams reliably
customer_reviews.text: This nailer jams up often - reliably. The slide that presses the nails to the front is too loose. It has small indents intended to keep nails from sliding behind or in front of it, but they're not enough and nails slide pass the slide, jamming the nailer. I have found a cheap nailer from Harbor Freight costing $20 to be reliable and it also handles staples. I'm very disappointed with Hitachi.
customer_reviews.author: TW Barney

customer_reviews.title: Needs a compressor
customer_reviews.text: My fault for not seeing this needed a compressor, but I did not want one that had to use a compressor so I haven’t been able to try it out yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jewel

customer_reviews.title: Good tool good price
customer_reviews.text: Great gun,hits hard, feels good in the hand, what’s not to like
customer_reviews.author: Brian G.

customer_reviews.title: Well built. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love, love this nail gun. Light weight, compact and well built. I bought a craftsman and dewalt before this, and this makes the other two looks like toy. Would definitely recommend and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: sealight88

customer_reviews.title: Not a single complaint
customer_reviews.text: Bought this nailer for my husband as we are doing a lot of home improvement projects. Worked great right out of the case! We have used it extensively over the past two weeks without any problems. We are using Bostitch brads. No jams or other problems. Very easy to use and light weight. My husband and the teen boys helping him love it! Purchased oil at Lowe's (simple and cheap) and he uses one of those pancake compressors and has plenty of power.
customer_reviews.author: Nursethis1965

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Loving Hitachi's pneumatics lately. Great nailer. Love the ability to change length of the brad (5/8-2 inch). Recommend
customer_reviews.author: Bob Gibson

customer_reviews.title: I love this Brad Nailer!
customer_reviews.text: I have a strong background in woodworking. I build lots of our own furniture and many other things around the house. I use this brad nailer to hold together my work as the glue dries. The 18ga nails have enough holding power on their own for many things but I would recommend using glue for sure. I have never had a nail jam after firing over 2000+ nails I have to say this is an awesome little nailer.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Fix It

customer_reviews.title: Great quality you can depend on
customer_reviews.text: Dependable Hitachi! No missed nails with this nailer. Buy the best to get best results is my advice. The price was much lower than our local Big Box Store and it arrived in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: K. Mullen

customer_reviews.title: The nailer works well enough but plastic piece fell off ...
customer_reviews.text: The nailer works well enough but plastic piece fell off on on first use! It is only a cosmetic piece but I would expect more attention to detail from the Hitachi brand! It leaves wondering if they took other shortcuts mechanically?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: worked very well on most tasks, but could not drive longer nails totally flush.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for grilling.
customer_reviews.text: And here I thought I was buying a small grill... Oh well, this Hibachi does a nice job with brads less than 2 inches. I had some small problems with 2 inch brads making Kennedyesque 90 degree turns and ending up where I didn't want them. Perhaps it's a problem with the brads or the materials (trim and mdf) not the nailer itself. Light and precise. I recommend this nailer.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Keys

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money on Hitachi products
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with Hitachi. This nailer did not last a year under very lite use. The countersink feature stopped working after 2 months. No more Hitachi tools for me.
customer_reviews.author: RICH

customer_reviews.title: Big quality in a small package
customer_reviews.text: Quality built, smooth quiet operation. Drives nails perfectly every time. I’ve run several boxes of nails through it and haven’t had any issues whatsoever. Very nice tool.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M. Salyers

customer_reviews.title: Very please and would recommend this to anyone interested in a finishing nailer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this at the last minute to complete the finish work on my kitchen remodel. Could not decide what finish nail gun to purchase but after endless searches and Youtube reviews, I decided to purchase this product. Very please and would recommend this to anyone interested in a finishing nailer.
customer_reviews.author: Ty A

customer_reviews.title: Wicked nice bradder
customer_reviews.text: Working well with Senco brad variety packs. Having an assortment of lengths is great. The depth adjustment works well as long as the air pressure is regulated in the recommended range. Sinks consistently, without jamming or damaging the wood. Hanging molding is much less tedious without hand nailing. 18g is a good mid-point between my palm nailer and 23g micro-pinner.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

product_meta.title: Hitachi NT50AE2 18-Gauge 5/8-Inch to 2-Inch Brad Nailer
product_meta.description:
Hitachi NT50AE2 2-Inch 18-Gauge Finish Nailer with Case

AMAZON.COM
The lightweight Hitachi NT50AE2 2-Inch 18-Gauge Brad Nailer is an ideal tool for a small carpentry projects. Featuring a high-capacity magazine, exhaust vent, easy depth-of-drive adjustments, and a removable nose cap for prolonged tool life, this pneumatic brad nailer will help you tackle everything from cabinet installation and picture-frame assembly to furniture construction and finish work.



Dual Firing Options for Precise or Continuous Driving
Featuring selective actuation for making tool-less firing transitions, the NT50AE2 Brad Nailer can be used for a variety of different applications. By simply sliding the selection control up or down with your hand, you can choose between intermittent and continuous firing. Intermittent firing is ideal for jobs that require precise driving, while the continuous setting can be used to fire nails at a rapid pace by using a bumping motion along the workpiece.Adjustable Depth of Drive for Accuracy
The NT50AE2 features a convenient depth-of-drive adjustment knob located near the nose. Simply turn the dial half way to make quick, accurate modifications to the driving depth with no tools required.

High-Capacity Magazine for Reduced Downtime
For further convenience, the NT50AE2 features a bottom-loading magazine that's designed for quick and easy loading of 5/8-2 inch brad nails with head sizes between 0.075 and 1.9 mm. The magazine has a capacity of approximately 100 brad nails (depending on the size of the nail), so you can go a long time between reloads. A visual nail indicator allows you to keep an eye on the number of nails in the magazine.

Designed for Comfort and Efficiency
With a lightweight aluminum body, the NT50AE2 weighs just 2.2 pounds and measures 10 x 9-3/16 x 2-3/8 inches (LxHxW)), so it's easy to maneuver. Its soft Elastomer grip provides optimum control and extended comfort for all-day jobs.

For further ease of use, Hitachi equipped the NT50AE2 with an adjustable, 360-degree exhaust vent. Also, an included no-mar nose cap protects the workpiece and the tool.

The NT50AE2 requires 70-120 psi operating pressure to function properly. It takes in air at a rate of 0.025 cubic feet per cycle at 100 psi.

The Hitachi NT50AE2 Brad Nailer is backed by a five-year limited warranty.

About Hitachi: A Tradition of Innovation
Hitachi Power Tools (Hitachi Koki USA, Ltd.) provides professional-grade power tools for a variety of applications, including woodwork, metalwork, concrete, drilling, cutting, and fastening. Hitachi is a leader in power tool research and development and has achieved many firsts in the power tool industry. Today, Hitachi continues the tradition of innovation and engineering with new features in addition to classic quality.

What's in the Box
NT50AE2 Brad Nailer, safety glasses, nose cap (mounted on tool), and protective case.




FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Hitachi NT50AE2 2-Inch Finish Nailer has a 2-inch brad capacity for larger finish and trim jobs. Its safety is behind the nosepiece for close quarter nailing. The selective actuation trigger switches between rapid bump fire or contact firing modes. The lightweight aluminum body and composite magazine provide for a tool that reduces user fatigue. The NT50AE2 also offers ease of use with a depth of drive dial and an adjustable (360-degree) exhaust. It has a capacity of 5/8-inch to 2-inch, 18-gauge brad nails. The visual nail reload indicator on its magazine shows when nail quantities are low. Weighing only 2.2-pounds, this nailer is best in class and features a no-mar tip and elastomer grips to keep the tool from slipping. This package comes with safety glasses, an air fitting, no-mar tip, hex bar wrenches and a carrying case. The Hitachi NT50AE2 2-Inch 18-Gauge Finish Nailer is warranted to the original purchaser to be free from defects in materials and workmanship for a period of 5-years from the original purchase date. In addition any pistons, drivers and O-rings associated with this tool are covered by a 90-day warranty. Hitachi Power Tools provides professional-grade power tools for a variety of applications, including woodwork, metalwork, concrete, drilling, cutting and fastening. Since its inception, Hitachi has pioneered innovative technologies that have improved the quality of craftsmanship worldwide. Hitachi is a leader in power tool research and development and has achieved many firsts in the power tool industry. Today, Hitachi continues the tradition of innovation and engineering with new features in addition to classic quality.

See more
feature_bullets: Hitachi Power Tools has renamed to Metabo HPT. Same great tools, with only a new name.
Selective Actuation allows the user to select bump fire or contact fire modes with the simple flip of a switch
At only 2.2 pounds, this finish nailer is lightweight & well balanced making it easy to use all day long
Elastomer grip adds comfort and prevents slippage
Tool less, easy to clear nose for quick and simple nail extraction should a nail jam during use
Depth of drive dial allows the user to easily adjust the drive depth for a professional finish

specifications.Warranty Description: 30 day money back guarantee and 1 year warranty
